events.title: Deposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on Venezuela
events.description: President protests innocence in US court as countries at UN meeting condemn Donald Trump’s ‘crime of aggression’ Venezuela crisis – latest updates The deposed Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty to drugs, weapons and narco-terrorism charges on Monday, two days after his capture by US special forces in an operation ordered by Donald Trump that sent shock waves around the world. The brevity and formality of the arraignment hearing in federal court in Manhattan – barely 30 minutes during which Maduro was asked to confirm his name and that he understood the four charges against him – belied the far-reaching consequences of the US action. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia news live: NSW police commissioner says extension on protest restrictions in Sydney ‘not about stopping free speech’
events.description: Follow today’s news live Albanese softens resistance to royal commission into Bondi attack as pressure mounts Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Independent senator David Pocock said he believes the prime minister should have already announced plans to bring federal parliament back early to address the Bondi beach terror attack. Pocock spoke to RN Breakfast this morning, saying: I take the point that drafting takes time, but we’ve seen plenty of times previously where government can pull together legislation very quickly when it wants to. … I think coming back early really sends a signal to the community that the government is taking their concerns seriously and moving quickly in response. This is a national issue, and I think we need a national response led by the commonwealth, led by the federal government, in conjunction with states and territories. Continue reading...

events.title: Security Council LIVE: ‘The power of the law must prevail’ amid Venezuela crisis, says Guterres
events.description: The Security Council met in emergency session in New York to address the US rendition of Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro from Caracas, a move that has sent shockwaves through the region and beyond. The UN chief António Guterres told ambassadors there must be respect for national sovereignty, “political independence and territorial integrity,” after warning on Saturday that the US had set a “dangerous precedent” for the world order. Follow the historic meeting live below from the UN Meetings Coverage team, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: AI images of Maduro capture reap millions of views on social media
events.description: Lack of verified information and rapidly advanced AI tools make it difficult to separate fact from fiction on US attack Minutes after Donald Trump announced a “large-scale strike” against Venezuela early on Saturday morning, false and misleading AI-generated images began flooding social media. There were fake photos of Nicolás Maduro being escorted off a plane by US law enforcement agents, images of jubilant Venezuelans pouring into the streets of Caracas and videos of missiles raining down on the city – all fake. The fabricated content intermixed with real videos and photos of US aircraft flying over the Venezuelan capital and explosions lighting up the dark sky. A lack of verified information about the raid coupled with AI tools’ rapidly advancing capabilities made discerning fact from fiction about the incursion on Caracas difficult. Continue reading...

events.title: 6.2-magnitude earthquake jolts western Japan
events.description: The initial quake was followed by a sizeable number of aftershocks. There was no tsunami warning issued and no immediate reports of injuries or major damage.

events.title: ‘Soy inocente’: Maduro defiant in surreal New York courtroom spectacle
events.description: The Venezuelan leader entered a heartfelt not guilty plea – and told a member of the gallery he was a prisoner of war Venezuela crisis – latest updates At noon on Monday, Nicolás Maduro was escorted into a Manhattan federal courtroom following his capture early on Saturday in Caracas, completing the seized Venezuelan leader’s stunning journey from his capital city to a US courtroom. It was a surreal display amid the fallout of a brazen US military operation to grab Maduro that has roiled global politics and stunned observers in the US and overseas. Continue reading...

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua’s driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and “driving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property”. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Massacre at Nigerian market leaves more than 30 dead as gunmen torch stalls, kidnap others
events.description: Armed attackers killed more than 30 people and kidnapped others during a violent market raid in Nigeria's Niger state, police said.

events.title: Drop draft proposals on death penalty for Palestinians, UN rights chief urges Israel
events.description: The UN’s top human rights official on Friday called on Israeli authorities to abandon plans for new legislation that would impose mandatory death sentences exclusively on Palestinians, warning the proposals violate international law and fundamental human rights standards.

events.title: Trump warning over Iran protests 'reckless' says foreign minister
events.description: The US president earlier said if peaceful protesters are killed, Washington "will come to their rescue".

events.title: Albanese softens resistance to royal commission into Bondi attack as pressure mounts
events.description: Law Council of Australia joined calls from families of victims, business community, sporting identities and some former Labor MPs to launch inquiry Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Anthony Albanese has softened his resistance to a royal commission into the alleged Bondi terror shooting, opening the door to a national inquiry amid growing pressure, including from victims’ families and some former Labor MPs. While the prime minister insisted his priority was still on immediate steps, including a review of Australia’s intelligence and law enforcement agencies, he said he was speaking with Jewish community leaders to “examine everything else required” to respond to the 14 December attack, which left 15 people dead. Continue reading...

events.title: DR Congo blames Rwanda-backed rebels for 1,500 deaths
events.description: Kinshasa says Rwanda-backed M23 rebels have killed 1,500 civilians despite a US-brokered ceasefire, as fresh clashes erupt near Uvira and tensions spill into Burundi.

events.title: Monroe doctrine "clearly not an acceptable doctrine in a modern world", law professor says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Claire Finkelstein, Professor of Law at the University of Pennsylvania, explains that the raid to capture Nicolas Maduro represents a violation of international sovereignty as well as infringing on US Congress' war powers. She adds that the Monroe doctrine referenced by Donald Trump is "a political doctrine about Western hegemony and it's clearly not an acceptable doctrine in a modern world".

events.title: Machado welcomes ‘huge step for humanity’ – as it happened
events.description: Venezuelan opposition leader says she plans to return to her country as soon as possible Deposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on Venezuela A UK minister would not be drawn into saying whether his government believes the US capture of Venezuela’s president was influenced by the country’s rich oil reserves . Asked on Sky News why he thought Donald Trump had captured Nicolás Maduro and said America would “run” Venezuela, Home Office minister Mike Tapp said: This is for Donald Trump to answer , and I think he has said in his press conference, which I watched with interest around narco-terrorism and that threat. Continue reading...

events.title: WHO research shows COVID vaccines still crucial in preventing severe illness
events.description: Up-to-date vaccination remains the most effective way to prevent severe COVID-19 illness, new research from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows, even as the pandemic has officially ended.

events.title: Iran protests: UN warns against further bloodshed
events.description: As protests in the Iranian capital, Tehran – sparked by increasing economic hardship and a cost-of-living crisis – continued for a ninth day, the UN Secretary-General said he was “deeply saddened by the reported loss of life and injuries,” resulting from clashes between security forces and protesters.

events.title: WATCH: Ohio police smash sunroof, drag injured driver from burning car after rollover crash
events.description: Ohio police officers smashed through a sunroof to rescue a trapped driver from a burning car after a crash. Dramatic body camera video shows the rescue.

events.title: US critics and allies condemn Maduro’s abduction at UN Security Council
events.description: Denmark and Mexico, also threatened by US President Donald Trump, warn that the US violated international law.

events.title: At least 30 killed and several others abducted as gunmen storm village in Nigeria
events.description: At least 30 people have been killed and several others abducted after gunmen attacked a village in Nigeria, police said.

events.title: At least 30 killed in attack on Nigeria village
events.description: It is the latest in a spate of violent attacks in Niger state, and comes a day after officials said schools could reopen following a mass abduction last year.

events.title: Health advances marked 2025 as wars and funding cuts strained systems
events.description: From eliminating deadly infections to expanding access to lifesaving vaccines, 2025 delivered meaningful progress for global health, according to the UN World Health Organization (WHO), offering cautious optimism at the close of a year marked by both breakthroughs and strain.

events.title: Colombian President Petro threatens military response after Trump warns Colombia may be next target
events.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said Monday he would "take up arms" against the U.S. if it attacks his country. This after President Trump suggested Petro could be his next target.

events.title: Rubio vows to eliminate Hezbollah, Iran operations from Venezuela after Maduro capture
events.description: Hezbollah condemns U.S. capture of Nicolas Maduro as Secretary of State Marco Rubio vows to end the terrorist group's decades-long presence in Venezuela.

events.title: Danish PM says US attack on Greenland would be the end of NATO
events.description: Mette Frederiksen's warning comes after Trump again threatened to takeover control of Greenland.

events.title: North Korea says latest missile tests involve hypersonic weapons system
events.description: North Korea says leader Kim Jong Un has observed test-flights of hypersonic missiles and underscored the need to bolster the country’s nuclear war deterrent

events.title: Man charged after allegedly firebombing rabbi’s car with Hanukah decorations in Melbourne driveway
events.description: Car with a billboard reading ‘Happy Chanukah’ allegedly set on fire in St Kilda East Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Victoria police have charged a man over an alleged Christmas Day arson attack on a rabbi’s car in Melbourne. The car, with a billboard reading “Happy Chanukah” on its roof, was firebombed on Christmas morning. Continue reading...

events.title: Opposition leader Machado says she hasn’t spoken to Trump since attack as she vows to return to Venezuela – live
events.description: María Corina Machado tells Fox News she would share her Nobel peace prize with US president after removal of Nicolás Maduro Deposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on Venezuela US foes and allies denounce Trump’s ‘crime of aggression’ in Venezuela at UN meeting What exactly is the US accusing Nicolás Maduro of and what’s in the criminal indictment against him that was unveiled by attorney general Pam Bondi at the weekend? The US alleges the deposed Venezuelan president has spent the past two decades working with international drug trafficking groups. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Coalition of the willing' to gather in Paris to revive Ukraine peace talks
events.description: European and US leaders will meet in Paris on Tuesday in a renewed push to end the war in Ukraine, with discussions focused on security guarantees and a near-finalised peace plan even as overnight Russian strikes killed civilians and underscored the urgency of diplomacy.

events.title: 'Deeply shocked': World leaders react to US attack on Venezuela
events.description: There has been a mixed reaction to a large-scale strike on Venezuela and Maduro's capture by the US.

events.title: Trump’s attack leaves China worried about its interests in Venezuela | Amy Hawkins
events.description: Maduro had just affirmed ‘strong bonds of brotherhood’ with Beijing when US made its shocking intervention Venezuela crisis – latest updates Hours before his life and the fate of his country was changed dramatically, Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, was exchanging smiles and handshakes with a Chinese delegation in the presidential palace in Caracas. On Friday evening, shortly before he was seized by US forces , Maduro wrote on Telegram of his meeting with China’s special envoy for Latin American affairs, Qiu Xiaoqi: “A fraternal meeting that reaffirms the strong bonds of brotherhood and friendship between China and Venezuela. Through thick and thin!” Continue reading...

events.title: Worst heatwave since black summer forecast for more than half of Australia
events.description: Fire danger expected to reach extreme levels in South Australia, Victoria and inland NSW this week Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast More than half of Australia is set to swelter in blistering temperatures in what is expected to be the worst heatwave since the devastating black summer bushfires. The Bureau of Meteorology warned that dry, hot conditions would create extreme fire conditions across several states as temperatures topped 45C in parts of the country. Continue reading...

events.title: Are Trump's threats to Iran helping or harming protesters?
events.description: The US might hit Iran "very hard" if the regime escalates its crackdown on anti-government protesters, according to US President Donald Trump. How do Iranians feel about these warnings?

events.title: All 116 injured in Swiss ski resort fire identified
events.description: Forty people were killed when a fire swept through a busy bar in Crans-Montana on New Year's Eve.

events.title: Maduro pleads not guilty as Trump seizes control of Venezuela
events.description: Toppled Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro appeared in a Manhattan federal court on Monday to face narcotics charges, following a dramatic US operation that captured him in Caracas. The stunning move by President Donald Trump sent shockwaves through world capitals, and raised urgent questions about the legality of American actions in the region.

events.title: American jailed for billionaire’s Monaco death, plot to kill wife exposed in long con, expert says
events.description: Crime expert analyzes Ted Maher's pattern from the deadly 1999 Monaco fire that killed banker Edmond Safra to his recent murder-for-hire conviction.

events.title: Iran offers citizens $7 monthly payments as protests spiral over economic crisis: report
events.description: Iran shifts from import subsidies to direct $7 monthly payments for citizens as the currency loses its value and protests intensify nationwide, according to reports.

events.title: Iran’s Khamenei lashes out at protesters as nationwide anti-regime unrest grows
events.description: Iran protests prompted Ayatollah Ali Khamenei to call demonstrators "enemy mercenaries" and "rioters" in his first public speech since nationwide unrest began seven days ago.

events.title: Maduro seized, norms tested: Security Council divided as Venezuela crisis deepens
events.description: The UN Security Council met on Monday against a sharply altered diplomatic backdrop, following US strikes on the Venezuelan capital and seizure of President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Ukraine: Attacks disrupt heating as temperatures plunge
events.description: Recent attacks across Ukraine have killed civilians, damaged critical infrastructure and cut heating and power supplies for millions, UN humanitarians report, as temperatures drop below freezing.

events.title: SEE PICS: Venezuelans worldwide celebrate as exiles react to Maduro’s capture
events.description: Venezuelans erupt in celebration after President Donald Trump announces Nicolás Maduro's capture, with celebrations in Miami, Chile and Spain.

events.title: Greenland warns Trump against any ‘fantasies’ of annexation
events.description: Greenland’s leader says there’s no room for ‘threats, pressure, and talk of annexation’ after a new warning from the US.

events.title: Maduro and wife plead not guilty to narco-terrorism charges
events.description: Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores have pleaded not guilty to all charges during their first court appearance in their federal narco-terrorism case.

events.title: World News in Brief: Escalating violence in Sudan, civilian danger grows in Ukraine, Ethiopia aid cuts
events.description: In Sudan, civilians continue to bear the brunt of escalating violence, particularly in the Darfur and Kordofan regions.

events.title: Security Council: New faces, old tensions as five nations take their seats
events.description: From deploying peacekeepers to conducting quiet – but at times heated – diplomacy, the UN Security Council sits at the heart of global decision-making on war and peace. As of January, five new countries will have a seat around the iconic horseshoe table.

events.title: Iran protests prompt new Trump warning over deadly government crackdowns
events.description: Nine days of anti-government protests engulf Iran as Trump warns of consequences. Iranian Americans praise president's support for demonstrators.

events.title: Thirty-two Cubans killed during US attack on Venezuela
events.description: Cuba's president said military and intelligence operatives were providing protection to captured leader Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: South Korea and China seek improved ties amid state visit
events.description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said he hoped for a "new phase" in ties with China during his state visit. Xi Jinping called for the countries to protect regional peace in a "more complex and turbulent" world.

events.title: Maduro says 'I was captured' as he pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charges
events.description: A defiant Nicolás Maduro declared himself "the president of my country” as he protested his capture and pleaded not guilty Monday to federal drug trafficking charges that the Trump administration used to justify removing him from power in Venezuela.

events.title: Maduro says 'I was captured' as he pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charges
events.description: Nicolas Maduro declared himself "the president of my country” as he protested his capture and pleaded not guilty on Monday to the federal drug trafficking charges that the Trump administration used to justify removing him from power in Venezuela.

events.title: Cuba says 32 Cuban officers were killed in US operation in Venezuela
events.description: Cuba has acknowledged the deaths of 32 Cubans in the American military operation that ousted Venezuela's leader over the weekend

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Europe's reaction muted as Trump repeats threats of Greenland annexation
events.description: Denmark's prime minister warned Monday that any US move to take Greenland by force would destroy 80 years of transatlantic security links, after President Donald Trump repeated his desire to annex the mineral-rich Arctic territory. FRANCE 24's Dave Keating reports.

events.title: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro’s narco case echoes US history of targeting alleged foreign drug kingpins
events.description: From Maduro to El Chapo: How the U.S. has pursued foreign leaders allegedly involved in international drug trafficking operations over the decades.

events.title: ‘It ought to provide a deterrent’: what US action in Venezuela means for Taiwan
events.description: Perception that Chinese-made weapons could not stop a ‘decapitation strike’ may give Beijing pause for thought The sight of a hostile regional superpower launching an overnight raid to depose the leader of a smaller neighbouring country could easily have sent pulses in Taiwan racing. The US on Saturday revealed the details of a surprise raid to capture Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro , who was whisked away to the US, where he was frogmarched into a court in New York on Monday . Continue reading...

events.title: NATO could end if US takes over Greenland — Danish PM
events.description: Denmark's Mette Frederiksen said "everything would stop" in the event of a US attack on another NATO country. Donald Trump has said that Washington should take control of the autonomous Arctic island.

events.title: Central African Republic President Touadera re-elected with more than 76% of vote
events.description: Central African Republic President Faustin-Archange Touadera has secured a third term after the December 28 election, consolidating his rule in a country long plagued by instability. The vote was marked by low turnout and opposition claims of fraud, while analysts warn that security gains remain fragile despite peace deals with rebel groups.

events.title: Greece says a radio failure that grounded flights is unlikely to be a cyberattack
events.description: Greece’s transport minister says a major radio communications failure that shut the country’s airspace on Sunday is unlikely to have been a cyberattack

events.title: Yemen aid response buckling under funding cuts as needs keep rising
events.description: Yemen’s already fragile humanitarian response is being pushed to breaking point by deep funding shortfalls, the UN warned in an update Sunday highlighting mounting risks for millions across the country.

events.title: ‘Do not give up on children’: Displaced by violence, a Haitian girl finds hope at school
events.description: A teenage Haitian girl who was forced to flee her home in Haiti’s capital, Port-au-Prince, due to gang violence has urged adults not to “give up on children.”

events.title: Venezuela orders nationwide manhunt for supporters after Maduro's arrest by US forces
events.description: Nicolas Maduro was arrested by U.S. forces on drug trafficking charges as Venezuela declares emergency, ordering arrests of supporters. Rodriguez sworn in.

events.title: Berlin blackout: How dangerous are left‑wing extremists?
events.description: A left‑wing extremist group has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Berlin power plant. What drives such an attack, and how serious a threat does this radical network pose?

events.title: Nigeria urges civilians to avoid debris from US-backed strikes on Islamists
events.description: In tonight's edition, Nigeria warns its communities near sites of US military airstrikes to watch out for unexploded ordnance. Also, The Pharaohs rise to the occasion in AFCON beating Benin in the opening game of the knockout phase in Marrakech. And hundreds of thousands of rural Tunisians struggle to get access to essential utilities such as drinking water.

events.title: Trump: We need to take Greenland - right now
events.description: Donald Trump has doubled down on his territorial ambitions for Greenland - despite warnings that his plans for the Danish territory could destroy NATO.

events.title: All 116 people injured in deadly New Year's bar fire identified, Swiss police say
events.description: All the people who were injured in a fire that tore through a New Year's celebration in the Swiss Alps have been identified, police have said.

events.title: Swiss police identify all 116 people injured in deadly New Year's bar fire
events.description: Swiss police say they've identified all the people who were injured in the fire that tore through a New Year’s celebration in a crowded bar

events.title: Off-duty deputy shot and killed while working security job in Texas, suspect apprehended
events.description: Off-duty Caldwell County deputy shot and killed while working security at a nightclub in Austin, Texs. Police investigation ongoing.

events.title: Tech-savvy thieves exploit obits, online posts to strike homes while families grieve, expert warns
events.description: Retired LAPD lieutenant reveals how burglars use obituaries to predict when homes are vacant, targeting families during their most vulnerable moments.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Anger in Papua New Guinea after Starlink ordered to shut down internet services
events.description: In mid-December PNG said the company did not have a licence to operate in the country and ordered it to halt operations Frustration is growing in Papua New Guinea weeks after the government ordered Starlink to shut down operations in the country as businesses, health providers and communities struggle without access to internet services. Starlink, owned by Elon Musk’s SpaceX, is a satellite internet company that provides internet to remote places. In mid-December, the National Information and Communications Technology Authority (Nicta) ordered the company to halt operations because it was not licensed in PNG. Continue reading...

events.title: AI photos fuel fake news about Nicolas Maduro’s capture
events.description: After President Donald Trump announced Nicolas Maduro’s capture in a social media post, AI-generated images claiming to show the incident flooded social media. These fake images were even used by some news sites and reposted by the official White House X account. Vedika Bahl talks us through what she’s seen online, and how misleading they may have been in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Pakistani counterterrorism police seize 2 tons of explosives and arrest 3 in Karachi
events.description: Pakistani counterterrorism police have raided militant hideouts in Karachi, arresting three suspects and seizing about 2 tons of explosives

events.title: A woman dies from cervical cancer every two minutes, UN says
events.description: A flood of questions drowned Jeanette in thought after she was diagnosed with cervical cancer. Would she be unable to conceive a child? Would she have to enter menopause at the early age of 31?

events.title: Another child dies in extreme conditions in Gaza: UNICEF
events.description: A sixth child has died in Gaza this month as the enclave’s people continue to endure dire living conditions linked to freezing rains and the Israel-Hamas war, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has announced. The development comes as aid agencies urged Israeli authorities to reconsider revoking the licences of dozens of humanitarian partners that provide assistance across the devastated enclave from 1 January.

events.title: Activist group says it was behind Berlin fire that cut power to thousands
events.description: The far-left Vulkan Gruppe says in a statement that targeting the fossil fuel economy, not cutting power, was the goal.

events.title: Progress for Ukraine talks in Paris uncertain with U.S. focus shifting to Venezuela
events.description: Ukraine's allies are meeting Tuesday in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country's security after a potential ceasefire with Russia. But prospects for progress are uncertain.

events.title: US-Venezuela: Is Greenland next and could the EU protect it?
events.description: Donald Trump's claims on Greenland are worrying Europe once again. After the US attack on Venezuela, concerns are growing over how far Washington might go — and if the EU has any real tools to defend Danish territory.

events.title: US scraps universal child vaccine guidance, drawing expert concern
events.description: On Monday, the US government rolled back decades of childhood vaccination guidance, a move that comes amid broader efforts by the Trump administration’s Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to reshape immunisation policy. Public health experts warn the change could leave children vulnerable to preventable diseases and hospitalisations.

events.title: LIVE: US abduction of Venezuela’s Maduro prompts global outcry
events.description: Condemnation comes as Nicolas Maduro appeared in a court in New York and pleaded not guilty to drug charges.

events.title: Eva Schloss, Holocaust survivor and stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at 96
events.description: UK's King Charles III praises Schloss for her lifelong work on 'overcoming hatred and prejudice' around the world.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela swears in interim leader, seeking to show it operates free from U.S. control
events.description: Delcy Rodríguez was sworn in as interim president, as the Venezuelan government sought to show its people and the world that it is being run independently.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won’t travel to India
events.description: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: 'I'm a prisoner of war' - In the room for Maduro's dramatic court hearing
events.description: During the 40-minute arraignment, Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, pleaded not guilty to drugs and weapon charges.

events.title: Ten found guilty of cyber-bullying Brigitte Macron
events.description: A Paris court found them guilty of "malicious" bullying towards the wife of the French president.

events.title: Israel kills two in Gaza as Palestinians call for Rafah crossing to open
events.description: Israeli forces bomb tent in al-Mawasi, killing a five-year-old girl and her uncle, taking death toll since truce to 422.

events.title: Alarms raised as Trump’s CDC cuts number of suggested vaccines for children
events.description: An American Academy of Pediatrics official warns that changes made by political appointees could harm children.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,412
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,412 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Venezuela: Germany hesitates to condemn US attack
events.description: The German government seems to have three things on its mind in regard to US capture of of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro: be cautious, wait and see and don't upset Donald Trump.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin still shivering amid power outage
events.description: Authorities say left-wing extremists likely carried out an arson attack that has left many Berliners without power. And alcohol can be purchased more cheaply in Germany than almost anywhere else in the EU. DW has more

events.title: US's long history of involvement in Venezuelan oil
events.description: The Trump administration is reportedly planning to meet executives of top US oil companies to discuss Venezuela this week, after the administration declared it would "run" the country and America's big oil would revive its oil industry. As Washington accuses Venezuela of "stealing American oil", we take a look at its long history of involvement in the Latin American country's vital sector.

events.title: Maduro says he is 'prisoner of war' - as Trump reacts to 'extraordinary' court hearing
events.description: Nicolas Maduro's arraignment was an "extraordinary moment in history", US President Donald Trump has said, as the deposed Venezuelan leader made his first court appearance since being captured.

events.title: Ukraine did not attack Putin's residence, says Trump
events.description: Donald Trump has said Ukraine did not target a residence belonging to Russian leader Vladimir Putin in an apparent drone attack.

events.title: 35,000 homes without power in Berlin for days after 'left-wing activists' attack power lines
events.description: About 35,000 homes are without power in Berlin after officials said left-wing extremists attacked high-voltage power lines.

events.title: New year dawns amid rubble and resolve in Gaza
events.description: As 2026 begins, residents of the Gaza Strip are confronting life in displacement camps and among the ruins of destroyed neighbourhoods – facing deep uncertainty after months of war and devastation.

events.title: Missing 4-year-old Florida boy found dead after massive 3-day search in Alabama woods
events.description: Tragic end to search as 4-year-old Florida boy missing in Alabama woods found dead after wandering from family property during holiday visit to relatives.

events.title: Ohio police hunt killer after dentist, wife found shot to death with children safe inside home: timeline
events.description: Manhunt underway after dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique found shot dead in their Columbus home. Two young children discovered safe at the scene.

events.title: Teen girl vanishes from South Carolina home, police fear she's in serious danger after monthlong search
events.description: Missing teen Mackenzie Dalton, 16, disappeared from South Carolina home in late November. Police believe blonde teen is in danger due to her age.

events.title: Pilot dies alongside 3 nieces on wedding day in tragic Arizona helicopter crash
events.description: Tragic helicopter crash kills pilot and his three nieces on his wedding day. Family devastated as celebratory flight turns deadly in remote canyon.

events.title: Sister warned Bryan Kohberger about 'psycho killer' on the loose before his arrest: 'Be careful'
events.description: Bryan Kohberger's sister revealed she warned him about a "psycho killer" after the Idaho murders, not knowing she was speaking to the actual killer.

events.title: Venezuela's new interim leader Delcy Rodríguez 'hates the West,' ex official warns
events.description: Venezuela's new interim president Delcy Rodríguez represents continuity of Maduro's regime, according to a former official as the 56-year-old faces U.S. sanctions.

events.title: Cuba's shadow in Venezuela: Havana’s intelligence and military ties exposed after Maduro raid
events.description: Cuba confirms 32 intelligence personnel killed in U.S. operation that seized Maduro, exposing extensive Cuban involvement in Venezuela's military systems.

events.title: Maduro capture echoes Noriega takedown that used rock music as psychological warfare against dictator
events.description: Nicolás Maduro's capture in Venezuela draws striking parallels to the dramatic 1989 U.S. operation that brought down Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega.

events.title: Israeli army vehicles enter Quneitra countryside village in southern Syria
events.description: Israel has, since the fall of al-Assad, extended its occupation of Syrian territory and staged raids and bombardments.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea’s junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea’s junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country’s electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: Who is in charge of Venezuela? And, what to expect from Maduro's court appearance
events.description: The U.S. forces' capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife in Caracas has left many people with questions. Here's what we know so far, including who is running the country.

events.title: Trump claims U.S. will 'run' Venezuela, but there are no troops in the country
events.description: What's next for the U.S. engagement in Venezuela? President Trump says the U.S. will run the country for now, but there are no American troops or diplomats in the country.

events.title: India: Gig workers fight for fair treatment and benefits
events.description: Millions of informal workers in India are heavily dependent on app-based platforms, with their livelihoods on the line as they negotiate the country's gig economy.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Salah stars for Egypt and Nigeria routs Mozambique to reach quarters
events.description: Egyptian star Mohamed Salah scored with the last kick in extra time to seal the country's 3-1 win on Benin in the Africa Cup of Nations last 16. Meanwhile, Nigeria enjoyed a 4-0 rout of Mozambique on Monday, marching into the African Cup quarter-finals.

events.title: Live: Opposition leader Machado plans to return to Venezuela 'as soon as possible'
events.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado said Monday she plans to return home "as soon as possible", and slammed the interim president in Caracas. The Nobel Prize winner vowed to "turn Venezuela into the energy hub of the Americas" and dismantle the "'criminal structures" that have harmed her country's people, as ousted leader Nicolas Maduro pled not guilty to drug charges at a New York court. Follow our liveblog for all the latest.

events.title: UN chief deeply concerned over ‘possible intensification of instability’ in Venezuela
events.description: Invoking the bedrock principle prohibiting the use of force against the territory and independence of any State, the UN Secretary-General told the Security Council on Monday there must be “full respect” for the UN Charter, in the face of the United States military intervention in Venezuela and seizure of President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Captured Venezuelan dictator Maduro pleads not guilty before judge cuts off outburst
events.description: Dethroned Venezuelan dictator Nicolas Maduro faces arraignment in New York federal court Monday on drug trafficking charges after dramatic U.S. capture.

events.title: Maduro and 'Lady Macbeth’ Cilia Flores marriage spells 'worst case' custody scenario
events.description: Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores face "worst-case scenario" in U.S. custody according to expert, with federal indictments on drug and weapons charges.

events.title: Mexican president rejects US sending troops to her country: 'I don't believe in an invasion'
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum condemns U.S. intervention in Venezuela, defends sovereignty amid Trump pressure over cartels and potential military action.

events.title: North Korea test-launches hypersonic missile system in front of Kim, nation says
events.description: Kim Jong Un oversaw hypersonic missile tests as North Korea ramped up weapons displays ahead of a major political conference, state media reported.

events.title: Which countries could be in Trump's sights after Venezuela?
events.description: Trump has made numerous threats against other nations in Washington's orbit.

events.title: 'We need Greenland': Trump repeats threat to annex Danish territory
events.description: The US president has repeatedly said he wants the island to become a part of the US.

events.title: US ‘adapt, shrink or die’ terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as “bold and ambitious” by the UN but could be the “nail in the coffin” in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington’s political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela: 'Regime change' not the plan, say US Republicans
events.description: House speaker Mike Johnson has said US troops are not expected to deploy to Venezuela. Meanwhile, gunfire briefly broke out by the presidential palace in Caracas overnight, witnesses said. Follow the latest.

events.title: India: Supreme Court denies bail to Muslim student activists
events.description: Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam have been in detention for more than five years without a full trial or conviction. They're accused of playing a "central role" in stoking the communal riots in Delhi in early 2020.

events.title: British teenager confirmed dead after Swiss bar fire - as all 40 victims are identified
events.description: A teenager with British citizenship has been confirmed dead after a fire at a bar in Switzerland - as officials say all 40 victims have been identified.

events.title: Iran has been shaken by a series of protests over the past 50 years. Here's a look at them
events.description: Over the past 50 years, Iran has been shaken by a series of protests

events.title: Progress for Ukraine talks in Paris uncertain with US focus shifting to Venezuela
events.description: Ukraine's allies are meeting in Paris to discuss security guarantees after a potential ceasefire with Russia

events.title: Gaza aid lifelines under strain as winter worsens
events.description: Humanitarian partners in the Gaza Strip are struggling to reach hundreds of thousands of vulnerable people as winter storms batter damaged homes and temporary shelters.

events.title: Chicago Teachers Union promotes Venezuela regime change protests organized by socialist groups
events.description: Chicago Teachers Union promotes Venezuela protest organized by socialist groups after Maduro's capture. Coalition demands end to aggression.

events.title: UK confirms joint airstrike targeting suspected ISIS weapons facility in Syria
events.description: British and French aircraft struck an underground ISIS facility in Syria believed to be used for weapons storage. RAF Typhoon jets targeted the site north of Palmyra.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Weather tracker: Arctic air grips Europe as severe winds batter Corsica
events.description: Subzero temperatures, heavy snowfall and powerful gusts mark a harsh start to 2026 for many It has been a cold start to the year across much of Europe, particularly in central regions, where temperatures dropped to double-digit negatives. Heavy snowfall hit parts of eastern and central Europe on New Year’s Eve, notably in Poland and Ukraine, with similar conditions across the Alps on the first few days of the year. The cold is likely to continue this week as an Arctic air mass sinks south across Europe, pulling temperatures well below the seasonal average outside south-east Europe. Temperatures are expected to fall widely by about 5C (41F) below average, with some areas – such as parts of central and north-eastern Europe – up to 10C lower than the norm. When wind chill is taken into account, it will feel even colder. Continue reading...

events.title: Delcy Rodriguez formally sworn in as Venezuela's interim president
events.description: As uncertainty simmers in Venezuela, interim President Delcy Rodríguez has taken the place of her ally Maduro, captured by the United States in a nighttime military operation, and offered “to collaborate” with the Trump administration in what could be a seismic shift in relations between the adversary governments.

events.title: Palestinian embassy in London opens in 'historic moment'
events.description: The Embassy of the state of Palestine has officially opened in the UK, marking what the Palestinian ambassador to London hailed as a "historic moment".

events.title: US actions in Venezuela ‘constitute a dangerous precedent’: Guterres
events.description: The UN Secretary-General António Guterres has said he is “deeply alarmed” over the standoff between the United States and Venezuela in recent months, which culminated on Saturday morning in the capture of President Nicolás Maduro by US special forces.

events.title: Results expected 5 January after landmark elections in Central African Republic
events.description: Voting proceeded largely as planned in the Central African Republic’s first-ever combined presidential, legislative, regional and municipal elections, and ballot counting is now complete, the UN peacekeeping mission (MINUSCA) said on Wednesday, with results expected to be announced on 5 January.

events.title: University of Illinois hosted state-funded committee meeting where professors advocated for reparations
events.description: University of Illinois professors advocate for collective reparations at Illinois meeting, calling for community payments beyond individual compensation.

events.title: Trump's seizure of Maduro raises thorny legal questions
events.description: US Attorney General Pam Bondi has said Maduro was brought to the US to "face justice". Some experts have concerns.

events.title: Trump administration sets meetings with oil companies on Venezuela: Report
events.description: The three biggest US oil companies have so far not had any meetings with the government, contradicting Trump's comments.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: What to make of Israel's military plans with Greece, Cyprus
events.description: Cyprus, Greece and Israel are set to step up joint military exercises and training. Turkey seems more concerned about the two EU members' growing procurement of advanced weapons systems from Israel.

events.title: Israel shuts door on Turkey in Gaza as Trump praises Erdogan, plays down clash
events.description: Israel is blocking any Turkish military role in Gaza as President Donald Trump praises Turkey's president and works to manage rising tensions over Gaza, Syria and other issues in region.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Harbin ice festival draws sculptors and spectators to northern China, in photos
events.description: Sculptors converged over the weekend on the frigid northern Chinese city of Harbin for the annual Ice and Snow Festival, as families traveled from afar to admire the towering ice sculptures and some visitors braved the cold with winter swimming. This is a photo gallery curated by AP photo editors.

events.title: Venezuela swears in interim president after defiant Maduro pleads not guilty
events.description: Delcy Rodríguez said she was pained by what she called the "kidnapping" of President Nicolás Maduro and his wife by the US.

events.title: Selfies and smiles: South Korea seeks 'new phase' in ties with China
events.description: South Korea's Lee Jae Myung snapped selfies with China's Xi Jinping as he pursues better ties with China in a four-day visit.

events.title: Bluefin tuna fetches record $3.2m at Tokyo auction
events.description: The 243kg fish went to a man known as the Tuna King, who said "the year's first tuna brings good luck".

events.title: Who is Cilia Flores, Venezuela's first lady seized by the US?
events.description: Long seen as a powerful figure, Flores has also faced allegations of corruption and nepotism.

events.title: Thousands stranded across Europe as Greece airspace disrupted
events.description: A fault with radio communications caused air traffic controllers to temporarily suspend arrivals and departures.

events.title: Cuba defiant as it braces for post-Maduro era
events.description: The prospects for Cuba - a close ally of Nicolás Maduro's Venezuela - are now bleak, writes the BBC's Will Grant.

events.title: From Caracas 'fort' to New York court: Maduro's capture in pictures and maps
events.description: Follow the operation to seize the Venezuelan president through photos, satellite images and maps.

events.title: US sharply criticised by foes and friends over Maduro seizure
events.description: The US taking of Venezuela's leader has faced strong criticism from both America's friends and foes.

events.title: Bowen: Trump's action could set precedent for authoritarian powers across globe
events.description: Trump seems to believe he makes the rules and others cannot have the same privileges.

events.title: Venezuela’s Machado says she hasn’t spoken to Trump since October
events.description: The opposition leader tells Fox News she is 'grateful' for Trump's 'courageous vision' after Maduro's abduction.

events.title: ‘New phase’: India eyes Bangladesh thaw with BNP before elections
events.description: In advance of elections in Bangladesh, India and the BNP are trying to reset historically strained ties. Will it work?

events.title: A US drug policy contrast
events.description: We compare and contrast Trump's indictment of Maduro for drug trafficking with his pardon of Juan Orlando Hernandez.

events.title: Sabalenka credits ‘Battle of the Sexes’ tennis match for ‘great fitness’
events.description: Women's number one believes the match against Nick Kyrgios helped her to up the intensity of her power-packed game.

events.title: Americans evenly split on Maduro’s abduction, poll shows
events.description: One in three Americans opposes the Venezuelan leader's abduction by US forces, a poll shows, while others are unsure.

events.title: Central African Republic’s Touadera wins third presidential term
events.description: Provisional results show Faustin-Archange Touadera received 76.15 percent of the vote in December 28 election.

events.title: Hundreds of tourists stuck on Yemeni island as tensions simmer on mainland
events.description: Hadramout governor says ports, airports will soon be in action after Saudi-backed forces ousted rebels from south.

events.title: Osimhen double for Nigeria downs Mozambique to seal AFCON quarterfinal spot
events.description: Nigeria will face Algeria or DR Congo in the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations quarterfinal after a 4-0 win against Mozambique.

events.title: Delcy Rodriguez sworn in as Venezuela’s president after Maduro abduction
events.description: Trump has signalled that Rodriguez could face dire consequences should she buck US priorities for Venezuela.

events.title: Egypt says it shares ‘identical’ views with Saudi Arabia on Yemen, Sudan
events.description: Comments come amid widening differences between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, once close partners.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news

events.title: 'Tuna King' pays record £2.4m for giant bluefin at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura will turn prized 243kg fish into sushi rolls selling for £2.4o at his restaurant chain A sushi entrepreneur has paid a record 510.3m yen (£2.4m) for a giant bluefin tuna at a prestigious auction in Tokyo’s main fish market. Kiyoshi Kimura, who styles himself the “Tuna King”, paid the top price for the 243kg (536lbs) specimen, which was caught off Japan’s northern coast. Continue reading...

events.title: Bruce Lehrmann makes last-ditch legal effort to appeal defamation loss
events.description: Former Liberal staffer alleges initial findings against him were ‘compromised’ in latest chapter of high-profile legal case Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Bruce Lehrmann has made a last-ditch effort to clear his name of findings that, on the balance of probabilities, he raped Brittany Higgins in Parliament House in 2019. The alleged incident has spawned more than a dozen legal cases . Continue reading...

events.title: Danish prime minister says a US takeover of Greenland would mark the end of NATO
events.description: Her comments came in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed call for the strategic, mineral-rich Arctic island to come under U.S. control in the aftermath of the weekend military operation in Venezuela.

events.title: A $400,000 profit on Maduro's capture raises insider trading questions on Polymarket
events.description: Online sleuths have tried to uncover who placed a winning bet on the Venezuelan leader's arrest to no avail. Still, prediction market watchers say the bet appears suspicious.

events.title: Kremlin condemns U.S. military operation in Venezuela
events.description: The U.S. essentially carried out the 'special military operation' that Russia planned for — and failed to accomplish — in Kyiv four years ago. Will this further embolden Russia?

events.title: Trump opposed regime change — but now he says the U.S. is 'in charge' of Venezuela
events.description: President Trump has long railed against regime change and nation building. Now he says "we're in charge" of Venezuela.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss, the stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at 96
events.description: Schloss, who was friends with Frank in Amsterdam and whose mother later married Frank's father, was a tireless educator about the Holocaust and was honorary president of The Anne Frank Trust UK.

events.title: Central African Republic: Touadera secures third term
events.description: President Faustin Archange Touadera has secured a third term, though the main opposition coalition boycotted the presidential election. Touadera is one of Russia's closest allies in Africa.

events.title: Germany: Alcohol prices well below EU average
events.description: Alcohol is cheaper in Germany than many other EU countries, with consumption still relatively high. However, there has been a fall in the amount that people, particularly young people and men, are drinking.

events.title: Venezuelas interim president: Who is Delcy Rodriguez?
events.description: Those who had hoped for Nobel Peace Prize laureate Maria Corina Machado to lead Venezuela were disappointed: The US and Donald Trump are going with former vice president Rodriguez.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.description: The German economy desperately needs a boost in 2026 after years of downturn. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: Massive bluefin tuna nets over $3 million at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura broke his own record for a giant bluefin tuna at the celebratory start-of-year auction at Tokyo's Toyosu fish market. He said customers would pay standard prices despite him splashing out.

events.title: France: 10 found guilty of cyberbullying Brigitte Macron
events.description: Ten people were accused of spreading false information about the French first lady, including about her gender and sexuality.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Nigeria and Egypt live up to expectations and qualify
events.description: Nigeria defeated Mozambique 4–0, while Egypt beat Benin 3–1 in extra time.

events.title: Nigeria sweep aside Mozambique and march into quarter-finals
events.description: Nigeria booked their place in the quarter-finals of the AFCON in Morocco with an emphatic 4–0 victory over Mozambique, easing through the round of 16 without ever needing to hit top gear⤵️ #AFCON #Nigeria #Mozambique #AFCON2025 #Osimhen #Lookman

events.title: AFCON 2025: Nigeria hammer Mozambique as Egypt struggle against Benin
events.description: The Super Eagles fly into the quarter finals after a show of strength against Mozambique, who failed to get a shot on goal.

events.title: The only solution for Europeans is to 'keep calm and stay united', defense specialist says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Frédéric Mauro, Associate Researcher at IRIS in Brussels, says that European leaders must be much be more vocal in defending European territories, and that the only solution is to 'keep calm and stay united', adding that 'union is what will deter Donald Trump' against annexing Greenland.

events.title: 10 people found guilty of cyberbullying France’s first lady Brigitte Macron
events.description: A Paris court found Monday 10 people guilty of cyberbullying France’s first lady, Brigitte Macron, by spreading false online claims about her gender and sexuality, including allegations that she was born a male.

events.title: Deposed Venezuelan leader Maduro pleads not guilty in US court appearance
events.description: Fraser Jackson, our correspondant in Washington, has more.

events.title: Ten guilty of cyber bullying France's first lady after false transgender claims
events.description: Ten people have been found guilty of cyber bullying France's first lady Brigitte Macron.

events.description: A massive 243kg (535lb) bluefin tuna has been sold for a record 510 million yen (£2.4m) to a Japanese sushi restaurant.

events.title: Finland's battle against fake news starts in preschool classrooms
events.description: Finland has been fighting fake news by teaching media literacy to children as young as 3

events.description: A Paris court has found 10 people guilty of cyberbullying France’s first lady, Brigitte Macron, by spreading false online claims about her gender and sexuality, including allegations she was born a man

events.title: Central Africa Republic President Faustin Archange Touadéra reelected, provisional results show
events.description: Provisional results have shown Central Africa Republic President Faustin Archange Touadéra won a third term in last month’s election

events.title: India's top court denies bail to 2 Muslim activists after 5 years in jail without trial
events.description: India’s Supreme Court has denied bail to two Muslim student activists, Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, who have been detained for years without trial

events.title: South Korean movie star Ahn Sung-ki, dubbed 'The Nation's Actor,' dies at 74
events.description: South Korean film star Ahn Sung-ki, whose prolific career earned him the nickname “The Nation's Actor,” has died

events.title: Syrian and Israeli officials set to resume US-mediated talks in Paris
events.description: Syrian and Israeli officials are set to resume U.S.-mediated talks in Paris, aiming for a security agreement to ease tensions

events.title: Vatican claims a Holy Year success with 33 million pilgrims
events.description: The Vatican has given a final accounting of its 2025 Holy Year

events.title: Photos show people in Lebanon enjoying winter weather on the slopes
events.description: People in Lebanon enjoyed winter weather and snow as they took to the slopes at the Mzaar-Kfardebian ski resort on Saturday. This is a photo gallery curated by AP photo editors.

events.title: Gaza: 100 per cent of basic food needs met for first time since 2023
events.description: For the first time since 2023, humanitarian assistance will provide Gazans with enough food to fulfil minimum nutritional needs.

events.title: UN chief condemns Israeli amendments targeting UNRWA operations
events.description: The UN Secretary-General has condemned amendments adopted by Israel’s Knesset to a law aimed at ceasing the operations of the UN agency assisting Palestine refugees (UNRWA), saying the measures must be immediately repealed.

events.title: Eerie surveillance video shows 'person of interest' in unsolved Ohio dentist murder case
events.description: Police say person of interest walked near Spencer Tepe and Monique Tepe's Columbus home between 2 a.m. and 5 a.m. when couple was allegedly murdered.

events.title: Florida man in red lingerie allegedly hid gun under prosthetic silicone breasts: ‘It was ugly’
events.description: A Florida man allegedly hid a gun under prosthetic breasts while wearing women's undergarments and trespassing at a construction site, deputies say.

events.title: Maduro, wife face 'worst-case scenario' as Trump vows to govern Venezuela and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Venezuelan leader Maduro, wife arrive at Brooklyn detention facility after capture by US forces
events.description: Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife arrived at the Metropolitan Detention Center in New York Saturday night and face drug conspiracy charges after being captured by U.S. forces Saturday.

events.title: Maduro jailed at New York detention center that held Diddy, Ghislaine Maxwell and Sam Bankman-Fried
events.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro will be detained at MDC Brooklyn, the same prison housing Luigi Mangione and where Diddy and Ghislaine Maxwell were held.

events.title: US military details timeline of operation to capture Maduro, revealing more than 150 aircraft involved
events.description: Joint Chiefs Gen. Dan Caine provides details about the high-stakes military operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro that was planned for months.

events.title: Trump says Cuba is ‘ready to fall’ after capture of Venezuela’s Maduro
events.description: President Trump says Cuba is “ready to fall" after the U.S. operation that captured Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro, cutting off a key economic and security lifeline to Havana.

events.title: Zelenskyy reacts to Maduro arrest: US 'knows what to do next'
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reacts to Nicolás Maduro's capture, suggesting the U.S. "knows what to do next" with dictators after military operation.

events.title: Venezuelan dissident outlines risks and opportunities as Venezuela enters post-Maduro era
events.description: Hope emerges for Venezuela's future as experts discuss rebuilding institutions and creating stable democracy after years of authoritarian control.

events.title: Iran and Maduro ties suffer major blow following US operation and capture of Venezuelan dictator
events.description: Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro's capture deals devastating blow to Iran's Western Hemisphere interests, experts say, weakening Tehran's anti-American alliance in South America.

events.title: What is Delta Force and what does it do? Inside the elite US Army unit that captured Maduro
events.description: What is Delta Force? President Donald Trump confirms the elite U.S. Army unit led the operation that captured Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro.
